author: ghudson
msg: (svn_ra_plugin_t): There is no svn -v; correct comment.

author: kfogel
msg: Remove brane-objected dash, and add a space elsewhere.

author: philip
msg: * tools/dev/bash_completion (_svn): Add options --no-auth-cache and
--non-interactive, remove options -D and --date.

author: philip
msg: Fix the issue 847.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(svn_wc_delete): Get a directory's deleted state from parent, and use
that to determine how to modify entry. Don't rely on an entry remaining
unchanged.
(svn_wc_add): Open access baton on new directory if in state deleted.
(svn_wc_revert): Make svn_wc_entry_t pointer const.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/update_tests.py
(update_after_add_rm_deleted): Add directory in state deleted test.

author: ghudson
msg: Clean up the colon-in-dates issue, by nuking the -D flag and adding
"{date}" as a revision specification.  This also lets you do things
like -r "{date}:rev" for date specs.
Also, stamp out the nascent convention of using svn_boolean_t to
report the failure (not success) of an operation.  0-on-success is
fine, but FALSE-on-success/TRUE-on-failure is just plain confusing.
Use 0 for success and -1 for failure, like POSIX system calls.
* svnadmin/main.c (main): Adjust for new return value type.
* tests/clients/cmdline/getopt_tests_data/svn_help_log_switch_stdout
clients/cmdline/main.c
(main, svn_cl__options, svn_cl__cmd_table): -D is gone.
* include/svn_opt.h (svn_opt_parse_revision): Adjust return type
and success/failure specification.
* libsvn_subr/opt.c (revision_from_word): Reverse sense of
success and failure to match the function it helps.  (It was
backwards before this commit, adding to the confusion.)
(parse_one_rev): New function to allow parsing the left and
right revision specifications without duplicating logic.
(valid_revision_number): No longer needed.
(svn_opt_parse_date): Rewrite using parse_one_rev.
